CRD_Act3Romance_ROM.synopsis: Wyll's Romance scene in Act 3. Wyll invited the player to a romantic talk near the banks fo the chionthar.
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM.how_to_trigger: - Use debug book (go to WYR, recruit wyll, use origin debug book to setup the romance scene, long rest, find and talk to wyll in camp)- Be in relationship with wyll, Save/don't save Ravengard in Iron Throne, return from Iron Throne, trigger a camp night.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath.synopsis: Wyll recruitment after you kill Karlach in camp.
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath.how_to_trigger: Recruit Karlach before recruiting Wyll and wait for Wyll to come to camp. When he does, kill Karlach and speak to Wyll after.

CRD_PostRecruitment.synopsis: Wyll's CRD directly after recruitment, in which you can discuss the tadpole.
CRD_PostRecruitment.how_to_trigger: Speak with Wyll in camp after recruitment.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_2.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. He is contemplative.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_129.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_129.text: As the Blade, I've faced untold brutes and beasts. Together we've seen illithid horrors most souls could merely fathom.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_118.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_118.text: I live at the mercy of fiends. A man with the horrid face of a devil, awaiting his future in Hells' blistered army.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_110.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_110.text: I live at the mercy of fiends. A devil's plaything awaiting a future in the Hells.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_6.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_6.text: I've lived at the mercy of fiends - a devil's plaything trying to right the Coast's wrong.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_27.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_27.text: But I've only now come to see who my true enemy's been.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_38.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_38.text: Maybe. But I think the right answer is much simpler than that:

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_134.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_134.text: Time is so godsdamned greedy. It races forward no matter how hard we rail against it.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_95.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_95.text: Not so long ago, I was dreaming of our own personal forever, endless nights in each other's arms.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_12.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_12.text: But time caught up with me. Father is dead. Baldur's Gate nears its ruin. My one and only duty must be to the city.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_142.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_142.text: Forever could only be a dream.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_115.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_115.text: I understand. The city needs you, and I'd only be getting in the way.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_149.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_149.text: Quite the opposite. I'd be getting in yours.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_151.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_151.text: We can still have it, Wyll. We can defeat the Brain and be together.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_121.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_121.text: One monster slain, then. And another after that, and then another. There will always be one more evil to fell.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_117.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_117.text: So this is a break-up? I should've known, after all I've given you.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_105.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_105.text: And none of it shall go to waste, you have my solemn promise. But - truth be told, it's not just Baldur's Gate I'm protecting.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_136.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_136.text: My father taught me more lessons than I can count. But perhaps the greatest one is this: a champion's heart's as sharp as a new blade.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_73.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_73.text: Pull me too close, and I'm destined to hurt you.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_16.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_16.text: I was thinking - how about one last dance. For old times' sake?

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_68.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_68.text: You mean so much to me. I can feel my heart bleeding.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_98.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_98.text: Maybe I can staunch it. Just - for a moment.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_164.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_164.text: One last dance, for old times' sake.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_80.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Wyll and the player bow to each other, and then slowly begin to dance. This one is sadder than before. The camer pans upwards as the dance continues, and the scene fades away.

JLatino: Reuse dance anims, slow them down, fade to black as dance starts

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Wyll and the player bow to each other, and then slowly begin to dance. This one is sadder than before. The camer pans upwards as the dance continues, and the scene fades away.

Short player branch

JLatino: Reuse dance anims, slow them down, fade to black as dance starts

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_83.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_83.text: You break up with me and then ask to dance? That's some godsdamned nerve.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_5.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_5.text: I deserve that. And I'm sorry.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_56.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_56.text: I'll leave you to your thoughts. I hope somewhere in them, you find peace.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll walks away, leaving the player standing there. The camera pans up, then the scene fades.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks away. The camera shows Wyll standing there. He closes his eyes and the scene fades.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_33.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_33.text: Time is so gods-damned greedy. It can never give, only take. My eternal soul is at its mercy.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_7.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_7.text: It builds mountains and deserts, only to tear them asunder. It fells armies, it conquers kings, queens - even gods.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_15.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_15.text: We blink, and we're gone. And our hopes, our memories, our heart-bonds are gone with us.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_51.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_51.text: It even comes for your people in the astral sea. Time may hunt slowly - but it still hunts.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_89.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_89.text: Lucky for us, I've found a way to stop it -

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_34.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll reaches out his hand in front of him, to the player, at the end of the line.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_53.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_53.text: I can't take your hand without hurting you, but I'll follow where you lead.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades back in. Wyll and the player are near the Chionthar, and walk towards a towering and impressive tree. Acorns are scattered underneath it. It is a beautiful night; the moon and stars shine bright. NOTE: Karlach CANNOT take Wyll's hand, they shouldn't be touching.See N41

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_150.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_150.text: All right. But this better be worth it.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes Wyll's right hand with their left. Wyll smiles and the scene fades out.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades back in. Wyll and the player are near the Chionthar, and walk towards a towering and impressive tree. Acorns are scattered underneath it. It is a beautiful night; the moon and stars shine bright.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_111.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_111.text: The Wilden Oak. Legend has it it's stood since the Age of Dawn.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_93.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_93.text: I used to come here and climb it when father's eye was turned elsewhere - daydream of the stories it might tell, if I listened close enough.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_157.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_157.text: The dragon lords sparking the skies above it. The moon elves first plucking the strings of the Weave.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_78.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_78.text: Standing here, I feel like I can see into forever.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves from the two of you and outwards. A vista of stunning and quiet beauty.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_116.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_116.text: Enjoy the view. Enjoy Wyll's quiet company.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_22.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_22.text: A beautiful story. I'm glad you told it to me.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_42.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_42.text: I was hoping you'd think so.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_29.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_29.text: I'm not sure I can see into forever. But it's still a nice view.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_0.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_0.text: My favourite in all of the Coast. All of Faerûn, even. Not even the Sea of Stars could rival its magnificence -

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_92.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_92.text: Seriously? You dragged me out here to look at a tree?

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_23.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_23.text: I did. But also to see something else:

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_109.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_109.text: I've been thinking a lot about forever. Moreso, I've been thinking everything that comes before -

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_17.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_17.text: And who I want at my side as it passes.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kneels to the ground. He takes an acorn and holds it in the palm of his hands, but keeps them close to his body.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_79.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_79.text: My mother always said the Wilden Oak's acorns held just a touch of wishing magic.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_107.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_107.text: If that be so, then may my greatest wish come true tonight:
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) At the end of the line, Wyll holds his hands out to you, with the acorn held in them.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_74.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_74.text: I love you. Will you be mine - today, and tomorrow, and reaching into eternity?

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_35.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_35.text: Gods. You've made me the happiest soul in all the Realms.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the acorn from Wyll's hands. He smiles, but remains kneeling.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_120.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_120.text: *Your skin flushes and your soul sings as you palm the acorn. Wishing magic, affection, love - whatever the cause, it's as real as the ground beneath you.*

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_76.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_76.text: Get down here, already. It's time we started our happily-ever-after!

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_101.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_101.text: Join Wyll in the grass. Give yourself to him completely.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_47.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_47.text: Shit, yes. Let's see the snake this devil's been hiding.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll, still kneeling, pulls the player to the ground and they start kissing intensely.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_153.context: CinematicNodeContext: They roll about under the tree as the camera pans upwards, showing the beautiful night once more, as the happy couple begin to make love under the comfort of the Wilding Oak. (Use all the cinematic discretion you like!) The scene then fades away.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll, still kneeling, pulls the player to the ground and they start kissing intensely.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: They roll about under the tree as the camera pans upwards, showing the beautiful night once more, as the happy couple begin to make love under the comfort of the Wilding Oak. (Use all the cinematic discretion you like!) The scene then fades away.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_125.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_125.text: It's about time. Let's see what the Blade can do with his weapon.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_50.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_50.text: Not yet, Wyll. Not 'til all this trouble is behind us.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_46.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_46.text: I understand, truly. All I need is you. The rest is just details.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_39.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_39.text: For now, let's enjoy this piece of eternity.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pulls the player to the ground. They sit, holding hands, as the camera pans up, showing the beautiful landscape ahead of our lovers.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_24.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_24.text: Get down here, already. It's time we started our happily-ever-after!

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_11.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_11.text: Sit with me. It's time we started our happily-ever-after.
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach sits next to Wyll, an intimate but safe distance. They talk all night.NodeContext: Joyously

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_77.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_77.text: I'm not sure. It's a lot to take in.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_3.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_3.text: It is. I swear, I've lived a thousand lives since I've known you.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_163.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_163.text: But I'm ready to live a thousand more, if you can bear me.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_165.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_165.text: Yes. I want to be with you, for as long as you'll have me.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_85.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_85.text: I don't want a commitment. But I'd welcome a good roll in the hay.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_100.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_100.text: Ours is such a beautiful story, and this isn't the ending I wanted to write.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_63.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_63.text: But - I can't resist you. I'd sooner know one unforgettable night than a lifetime of 'what ifs'.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll casts aside the acorn and holds his hand to the player.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_146.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_146.text: Gods, I want you. But I can't take your body without taking your heart.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_119.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_119.text: I don't want a commitment. But I'd welcome a good roll in the hay.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_124.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_124.text: I - I understand. All the more fool am I for pressing my fortunes.
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll stands up at end of the line, still holding the acorn.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_104.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll hands you the acorn at the end of the line.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_9.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_9.text: *Your stomach falls briefly as the acorn touches your hand. You shiver with melancholy - and hope.*

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_75.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_75.text: May you be granted every wish you ask for. You deserve each and every one.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll walks away, leaving the player holding the acorn in their hand. The camera pans upwards showing the gorgeous night sky.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_52.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_52.text: I can't give you forever, Wyll. But I can give you tonight.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_127.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_127.text: Oh gods, no. You've got the wrong idea about all this.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_156.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_156.text: Gods, no. Have you looked at yourself? You're hideous.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_59.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_59.text: All this time, and that's still what you see?

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_84.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_84.text: The Wilden Oak. Legend has it it's stood since the Age of Dawn.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_65.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_65.text: I used to come here and climb it when father's eye was turned elsewhere - daydream of the stories it might tell, if I listened close enough.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_55.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_55.text: The dragon lords sparking the skies above it. The moon elves first plucking the strings of the Weave.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_132.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_132.text: Standing here, I feel like I can see into forever.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_112.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_112.text: All right. But this better be worth it.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_88.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_88.text: We've got big problems to solve, Wyll. Maybe later.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_40.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_40.text: A toll of the bell - it's all I ask. Our problems can wait that long.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_159.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_159.text: I couldn't have said it better. Let's go.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_97.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_97.text: Sorry, but a 'no' will have to do.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_14.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_14.text: Understood. Your will is strong, and I would have it no other way.
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll withdraws his handNodeContext: Disappointed, holding back his sdaness.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_139.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_139.text: Dance. And when you do, think of me.
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns and walks away, leaving you alone.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_106.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_106.text: Dance. Remember your precious moment with Wyll.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player dances, mimicking the moves Wyll made in the second romance night. The scene fades.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_126.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves upwards, showing the player from above, then fades away.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_155.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_155.text: Lucky for us, I've found a way to stop time -

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_69.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_69.text: Time is so gods-damned greedy. It can never give, only take.

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_71.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_71.text: So you'd think. But the right answer is much simpler than that:

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_37.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_37.text: The poignant tedium of your story?

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_57.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_57.text: I'd like to think not. The answer is much simpler than that:

CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Act3Romance_ROM_4.text: How is this a question? The answer is Mizora. It's always been Mizora.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_1.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_1.text: There's no lie a devil won't tell, no soul it won't reap.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_17.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_17.text: If I'd let Karlach live, she'd have brought the Blood War to the Sword Coast and set the whole of it ablaze.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_32.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_32.text: You did the right thing. Another fiend, cast back into the Hells.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_14.speaker: Narrator
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_14.text: *For a brief moment, you minds become one, and a single emotion rises above all others: doubt.*

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_21.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_21.text: We've a lot in common, it seems. An aversion of devils for one. A parasite stuck in our brains for another.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_0.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_0.text: I haven't sprouted a tentacle just yet - but I'm thinking it's only a matter of time.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_2.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_2.text: I propose an alliance. We search for a cure; I pledge you my talents, and you pledge me yours.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_33.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_33.text: Apart, we can roar. But together, we'll thunder.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_34.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_34.text: Some call me the Blade of Frontiers. Others, the Pride of the Coast, or the Protector.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_28.speaker: Shadowheart
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_28.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_11.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_11.text: 'Hero,' 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_26.speaker: Shadowheart
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_26.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_7.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_7.text: You can just call me Wyll.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_19.speaker: Player
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_19.text: Are you sure we did the right thing, killing Karlach?

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_4.speaker: Gale
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_4.text: I'm placing my bets on a resounding 'no'. An innocent tiefling died by our hands.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_10.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_10.text: I - no, my fellow. You've got it all wrong.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_8.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_8.text: I chased Karlach through the flames of Avernus. Her axe split the living and undead alike.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_18.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_18.text: She - she was a danger to the people, my people. What kind of man would I be if I didn't keep them safe?
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_18.context: NodeContext: Unsure of himself, but feigning confidence

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_25.speaker: Player
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_25.text: Let's partner up and find a cure for this infection.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_13.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_13.text: Consider my blade yours, 'til death makes me lay it down.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_24.speaker: Player
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_24.text: A man of courage. It would be an honour to have you at my side.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_9.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_9.text: The honour is mine. Consider my blade yours, 'til death makes me lay it down.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_5.speaker: Player
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_5.text: I think you should go your way, and I'll go mine.

Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_15.speaker: Wyll
Recruitment_PostKarlachDeath_15.text: Then goodbye it is. May the path rise to meet you, wherever it leads.

CRD_PostRecruitment_16.speaker: Narrator
CRD_PostRecruitment_16.text: *A tingle runs through your head and down to your feet.*

CRD_PostRecruitment_8.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_8.text: Ah, there it is - that shiver. Our little brain-worms have made fast friends, it would seem.

CRD_PostRecruitment_4.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_4.context: NodeContext: A leading question. A little bit of pause after the comma, and then a bit slower to end.

CRD_PostRecruitment_19.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_19.text: Surprisingly fine, in spite of it all.

CRD_PostRecruitment_9.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_9.text: 'Surprising' is just the word, isn't it?

CRD_PostRecruitment_5.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_5.text: Before the illithids' unscheduled surgery, I'd felled hundreds of beasts and a fair few fiends.

CRD_PostRecruitment_23.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_23.text: The tadpole's weakened me, suppressed greater talents. But beyond that -

CRD_PostRecruitment_25.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_25.text: I've shown no sign of turning. No nausea, no pain, not even a hot flash.

CRD_PostRecruitment_12.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_12.text: There are others, too - these 'True Souls' that worship the Absolute.

CRD_PostRecruitment_28.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_28.text: Not the best company to be sharing. Blessedly, their god's remained quiet to us.

CRD_PostRecruitment_1.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_1.text: I have reason to believe the parasite is touched by Netherese magic.

CRD_PostRecruitment_18.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_18.text: Netherese? Ancient magic, that. Netheril is a memory so distant, I wager even the elves have forgotten.

CRD_PostRecruitment_6.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_6.text: We could conjecture all night. I suppose the 'why' doesn't matter so much as the 'what next'.

CRD_PostRecruitment_13.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_13.text: And that answer is plain as the horns on a wardevil's head: we get these things out.

CRD_PostRecruitment_0.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_0.text: Let's get some rest. Dawn comes sooner than we think.

CRD_PostRecruitment_26.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_26.text: Something's special about us. Or at least, about our tadpoles.

CRD_PostRecruitment_10.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_10.text: Indeed. Perhaps the worms' vat was poisoned. Perhaps we're uncommonly fit.

CRD_PostRecruitment_27.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_27.text: Or perhaps the tadpoles are merely on holiday.

CRD_PostRecruitment_14.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_14.text: It makes no sense, I know. Why haven't we turned?

CRD_PostRecruitment_21.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_21.text: Perhaps the worms' vat was poisoned. Perhaps we're uncommonly fit.

CRD_PostRecruitment_22.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_22.text: We could probably dig up some poison mushrooms, if you're that keen to be sick.

CRD_PostRecruitment_2.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_2.text: Heh. I speak out of curiosity, not wishful thinking. At least I'll know to skip supper if you're doing the cooking.

CRD_PostRecruitment_29.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_29.text: Nervous. I don't like the idea of that thing in my brain.

CRD_PostRecruitment_30.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_30.text: It's natural, to suffer a touch of worry. But an illithid worm should be causing more than mild anxiety.

CRD_PostRecruitment_24.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_24.text: Confident. No tiny tadpole will be getting the best of me.

CRD_PostRecruitment_3.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_3.text: Courage in danger's shadow. I love to see it.

CRD_PostRecruitment_17.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_17.text: But shouldn't the shadow have crept closer, gone darker by now?

CRD_PostRecruitment_20.speaker: Player
CRD_PostRecruitment_20.text: I'm more interested in how you feel.

CRD_PostRecruitment_7.speaker: Wyll
CRD_PostRecruitment_7.text: Healthy. And troubled by that fact.
